intro: Hieracium habrodon, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, broadly lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium habrodon is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
